dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Dahanukar, N. 2010. Badis ferrarisi. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: The species is found in rivers in Myanmar. The species was first identified from a market (Kalaymyo). It has now been found in several Chindwin and Irrawadyy drainages, on the eastern slopes of the Chin Hills. It is also present in Manipur, India.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 16 - 17; Dorsal soft rays (total): 8 - 9; Analsoft rays: 7 - 8; Vertebrae: 26 - 28

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Possesses a distinct blotch on superficial portion of the cleithrum, but distinguished by color pattern of flanks which includes about 11 dark brown to blackish vertical bars, commonly connected by similarly pigmented horizontal band, and by having single short extrascapular with one distal pore instead of two.  Interorbital space 5.9-6.8% SL.  Rounded caudal fin with no dark blotch on caudal peduncle (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Dahanukar, N.

Reviewer/s
Britz, R. & Allen, D.J.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Badis ferrarisi was first found in streams and rivers in Myanmar. It has now been found in several Chindwin and Irrawadyy drainages, on the eastern slopes of the Chin Hills. It is also present in Manipur, India. The species has been found in a number of dispersed areas around the type locality, in the absence of significant threats, it is assessed as Least Concern.
